title: Enhancing Patient Care Practical Skills: Applying Cognitive Load Theory to Mitigate Complexity in Secondary Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Students can identify complex elements of fraction operations with over 80% accuracy based on cognitive load theory
Learners can categorize and explain intrinsic/extraneous cognitive load occurring during problem-solving into three types
Students can apply strategies to improve working memory efficiency by over 25% when solving complex math problems using digital tools
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
